laboratory_examinations.findings: Minimal lower lobe subsegmental atelectatic changes along with a mild degree of perihilar pulmonary vascular congestion.
3-cm mass occluding the left mainstem bronchus, extending into the left upper and lower lobe bronchi.
No lymphadenopathy; no fluorodeoxyglucose accumulation seen in the left endobronchial lesion.
Benign squamous mucosa with extensive submucosal fibrosis and mild chronic inflammation; no tumor seen.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Surveillance bronchoscopy and CT scanning demonstrate no evidence of recurrent disease.
